Entity: California Department of Tax & Fee Administration
Description: Get relief from penalty, collection cost, and interest. You can also get copies of tax records and up to a 3- month filing extension on your tax returns.

Service name: Business income tax relief and filing extensions
Description: Businesses impacted by the wildfires may postpone filing and paying income taxes. The deadline for them is now October 15, 2025.

Service name: Employer payroll tax and reporting extensions
Description: California employers directly affected by an emergency or disaster may request an extension of up to two months to file their state payroll reports and to deposit state payroll taxes with the EDD, without penalty or interest.
Mail:
Employment Development Department
PO Box 826880
Sacramento, CA 94280-0001
Other (Notes): EDD offers services to support employers impacted by disasters. This includes disaster relief payments, extensions for payments, and payroll reports.

Service name: Resources and Steps for Business Recovery

Description: CalOSBA offers resources and support for businesses and workers impacted by the wildfires. This includes financial help, recovery programs, and workforce support.
If you lost your job due to the fire, apply for unemployment benefits.

Entity: California Department of Financial Protection & Innovation
Description: Get mortgage relief for structures damaged or destroyed by the LA firestorms. The state worked with major lenders to offer mortgage relief to LA firestorm survivors. Over 400 lenders committed to: Temporarily reduce or pause mortgage payments for 90 days, Waive late fees for 90 days, Protect owners from new foreclosures or evictions for 60 days, Not report late payments to credit agencies

California's State Supplemental Grant Program, administered by the Department of Social Services, may provide grant funds to assist people who have suffered damage in a disaster area declared by the President when the federal assistance to Individuals and Household Program (IHP) is implemented.
We have help if you: lost a pet, had to leave a pet behind, need shelter for your pet

This guide provides information about the types of federal, state, and local disaster assistance services available in California. Although some of the resources are restricted to individuals or households with eligible immigration status, there are many services available to all Californians impacted by disasters.

Resources provided by California's Department of Insurance to assist with insurance issues brought about by the recent LA Wildfires.

Service name: One-Year Moratorium on Loss of Service
Description: State law protects residents. It prevents insurance companies from canceling or not renewing home insurance polices for one year in areas near a wildfire. This 1-year moratorium applies to all residents in the affected area, including total and no loss.
How to obtain help with filing an insurance claim or to resolve an issue with an already filed claim.

Service name: Top Ten tips for Wildfire Claims
Description: Top ten tips for managing insurance claims in the event of a disaster.

Replace titles for vehicles registered in California. Fees are waived for titles lost in the fires.

Find answers ot questions about 2024-2025 Los Angeles County fire victim tax relief.
Los Angeles County individuals and businesses impacted by fires that began on January 7, 2025, qualify for a postponement to file, and pay taxes until October 15, 2025.

Governor Newsom has suspended penalties and interest on late property tax payments for a year, effectively extending the state property tax deadline, for those living in communities impacted by the Los Angeles firestorms.

Service name: Property Reassessment and Base Year value transfer
Description: In the event a fire, earthquake, or flooding damages or destroys your property, you may be eligible for property tax relief. In such cases, the county assessor will reappraise the property to reflect its damaged condition. In addition, when it is rebuilt in a like or similar manner, the property will retain its prior value (Proposition 13) for tax purposes.
